00018 /*
00019  * TopicCounts.h
00020  * The main structure that stores the sparse
00021  * topic counts vector. It uses a blocked
00022  * allocation scheme in that memory is allocated
00023  * and deallocated in blocks. Blocked allocation
00024  * is used to reduce heap fragmentation.
00025  *
00026  * The elements are of the type cnt_topic_t
00027  * which packs both the topic and the count
00028  * into a single 64bit integer.
00029  *
00030  * Supports a map-view of the sparse vector,
00031  * but you don't have order information in
00032  * this view. So use with discretion.
00033  *
00034  * Its a struct for speed. So everything is
00035  * public. Don't mess with the items, length
00036  * and origLenth if you aren't sure about
00037  * what you are doing. Use the methods
00038  * provided making sure the assumptions hold
00039  *
00040  *  Created on: 14 Oct, 2009
00041  *      
00042  */
00043 
00044 #ifndef TOPICCOUNTS_H_
00045 #define TOPICCOUNTS_H_
00046 
00047 #include "types.h"
00048 #include <algorithm>
00049 #include "boost/unordered_map.hpp"
00050 #include "tbb/atomic.h"
00051 #include "comparator.h"
00052 #include <vector>
00053 
00054 class simple_map;
00055 
00056 typedef struct TopicCounts {
00057     cnt_topic_t* items; //The actual array holding data
00058     //which is dynamically reshaped
00059     //This is always sorted in descending
00060     //order and only has non-zero entries
00061     //Methods do not check for uniqueness
00062     //but assume uniqueness.
00063     //Responsiblity of user to ensure
00064     //uniqueness
00065 
00066     topic_t length; //The number of elements stored in the array
00067 
00068     topic_t origLength; //The size of the allocated array
00069 
00070     std::vector<cnt_topic_t> vec_items;
00071 
00072     //mapped_vec tmp_map; //A temporary map to hasten some
00073     //internal update operations
00074     int frequency;
00075     bool QUIT;
00076 
00077     /***** Init *****/
00078     TopicCounts();
00079     TopicCounts(int length);
00080     TopicCounts(cnt_topic_t* it, int len);
00081     TopicCounts(const std::string& counts);
00082     void init(cnt_topic_t* it, int len);
00083     void init(const std::string& counts);
00084     ~TopicCounts();
00085     void assign(int length, bool setLen = true);
00086     void setLength(int length_);
00087     /***** Init *****/
00088     /***** Getters *****/
00089     void findOldnNew(topic_t oldTopic, topic_t newTopic, topic_t** oldTop,
00090             topic_t** newTop);
00091     int get_frequency();
00092     cnt_t get_counts(topic_t topic);
00093     int convertTo(mapped_vec& map, int mult = 1) const;
00094     void convertTo(simple_map& map, int mult = 1) const;
00095     void convertTo(std::string& counts) const;
00096     int convertTo_d(mapped_vec& map, double mult) const;
00097     //int computeFrequency();
00098     //bool matchFrequency();
00099     /***** Getters *****/
00100 
00101     /***** Setters *****/
00102     bool findAndIncrement(topic_t topic);
00103     bool findAndDecrement(topic_t topic);
00104     //void setFrequency();
00105 
00106     void compact();
00107 
00108     void addNewTop(topic_t topic, cnt_t count = 1);
00109     void addNewTopAftChk(topic_t topic, cnt_t count = 1);
00110     void upd_count(mapped_vec& delta, tbb::atomic<topic_t>* t = NULL);
00111 
00112     //Convenience updates
00113     void operator+=(TopicCounts& inp);
00114     void operator-=(TopicCounts& inp);
00115 
00116     void removeOldTop(topic_t ind, cnt_topic_t& ct);
00117 
00118     void replace(TopicCounts& tc);
00119 
00120     void decrement(topic_t ind, topic_t** newTop);
00121     void increment(topic_t ind);
00122     /***** Setters *****/
00123 
00124     //Test & Debug

00126     TopicCounts(mapped_vec& map);
00127     bool equal(const TopicCounts& expected);
00128 } topicCounts;
